trans-unit.source:
\n

Represents a class member, such as a property or event.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxxxx x xxxxx xxxxxx$ xxxx xx x xxxxxxxx xx xxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
This is an abstract base class.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxxx xx xx xxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The name of the member.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The name of the member.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets or sets an array of attributes.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xx xxxx xx xxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets the collection of attributes for this member.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source: true if this member should be set only at design time; false if the member can be set during run time.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$ xx xxxx xxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxx xx xxxxxx xxxx$ $xxxxxx$xxxxx$$xxxxxx$ xx xxx xxxxxx xxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxx xxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets the name that can be displayed in a window, such as a Properties window.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxx xxxx xxx xx xxxxxxxxx xx x xxxxxx$ xxxx xx x Xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The name to display for the member.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xx xxxxxxx xxx xxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets the name of the member.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The name of the member.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The hash code for the name of the member.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xxxx xxx xxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Creates a collection of attributes using the array of attributes passed to the constructor.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxx x xxxxxxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxx xxx xxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Compares this instance to the given object to see if they are equivalent.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxx xxxxxx xx xxx xx xxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The object to compare to the current instance.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source: true if equivalent; otherwise, false.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$ xx xxxxxxxxxx$ xxxxxxxxx$ $xxxxxx$xxxxx$$xxxxxx$.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

When overridden in a derived class, adds the attributes of the inheriting class to the specified list of attributes in the parent class.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxxxxxxxxx xx x xxxxxxx xxxxx$ xxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxx xx xxxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Finds the given method through reflection, searching only for public methods.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxx xxx xxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx$ xxxxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The component that contains the method.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The name of the method to find.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

An array of parameters for the method, used to choose between overloaded methods.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xx xxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxx xxx xxx xxxxxx$ xxxx xx xxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The type to return for the method.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xx xxxxxx xxx xxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Finds the given method through reflection, with an option to search only public methods.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxx xxx xxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx$ xxxx xx xxxxxx xx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The component that contains the method.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The name of the method to find.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

An array of parameters for the method, used to choose between overloaded methods.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xx xxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxx xxx xxx xxxxxx$ xxxx xx xxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The type to return for the method.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xx xxxxxx xxx xxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Whether to restrict search to public methods.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxx xx xxxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxx xxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Returns the hash code for this instance.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxx xxx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxx xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Retrieves the object that should be used during invocation of members.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxx xx xxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The potential invocation target.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The object to be used during member invocations.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xx xxxx xxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source: type or instance is null.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xx$xxxx$$xx$ xx $xx$xxxxxxxx$$xx$ xx $xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets a component site for the given component.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx x xxxxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxx xxxxx xxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The component for which you want to find a site.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxx xxx xxxx xx xxxx x xxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The site of the component, or null if a site does not exist.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxx$ xx $xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$ xx x xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxx.$$x$$x
